node.text:
More terrain is opening in the #MammothBikePark! The gondola will start spinning to McCoy Station on Friday in addition to Chair 16 (Fri-Sun) and Discovery Chair (daily). Midtown, Velocity, Chain Smoke and Twilight Zone open Friday.

🚵 @tucker_keating @oakleybike @girocycling @gopro 📹 #gopro

node.text: Shake off that cabin fever and let ‘em rip like Woolly – Second Season is officially ON at Mammoth. The vibe is alive at 11,053’ and the good times are all-time right now. Don’t miss out on the springtime fun, Mammoth is open daily until Memorial Day.

node.text:
Today, and every day on the mountain, we celebrate the life and legacy of Mammoth Mountain founder, Dave McCoy. #ThankYouDave

Video shot February 2020

node.text: Temps are dropping and snow is in the forecast! Our snowmaking team will be ramping up as we work towards opening day. We will follow up early next week with more information on what the storm produced and what’s to come. As always, we can’t thank our Mammoth Family enough for your patience and understanding during these ever-changing times. #MammothStories @mbrownlie @hellyhansen

node.title: A Statement from President & COO, Mark Brownlie

node.text:
With Mother Nature’s blessing, Mammoth Mountain will open for skiing and riding on November 14, 2020. There are endless questions regarding what winter at Mammoth will look like, and while we don’t have all of the answers yet, we’re just excited as you at the prospect of getting back on snow.

At present, we plan to prioritize access to Mammoth Mountain for season pass holders. We will control resort visitation levels to avoid overcrowding by tightly regulating the number of daily lift tickets, which will be available by advance purchase only. Walk-up sales of lift tickets will no longer be available, allowing us to further manage capacity and reduce contact points in our lodges. Thanks to the vision of our founder Dave McCoy, Mammoth Mountain has an exceptional lift network with over 3,500 skiable acres and plenty of room to enjoy skiing and riding.

Visit the link in our bio or our Stories for the full statement from Mammoth Resorts President & COO Mark Brownlie and more information on 20/21 operations.

node.text:
New to the #MammothBikePark, renovated this week and ready to shred, the Bosch eMTB Flow Trail was built specifically for the extra juice available on an e-bike. An uphill rock garden and rollers, flowy jumps, berms and a few features on loan from the Unbound Terrain Parks make this trail an absolute blast. Located right above Main Lodge, this ¾ mile loop is perfect for lapping out and dialing in your equipment. 

As a reminder, class-1 e-bikes are allowed throughout the park and are available for rent at Main Lodge and the Mountain Center in The Village. @boschebikesystems.us @just_gabetaylor @oakley @girocycling Video: @petermorning

node.title: Bosch eMTB Flow Trail Now Open

node.text: Here’s to a community borne from mountains. Because, while seasons change, the mountains always endure. From big city or small, snowy town – we’re all skiers and riders. And, when we stand together, we’re as tall as the mountains. #WeAreTheMTNS. 💙⛰️💛 With gratitude for this amazing community, @IkonPass doubled renewal discounts for 20/21, and extended all savings until May 27. Together, we will endure.

node.text:
We are beyond stoked to be voted "Best Overall Terrain Park" in the country in the @snowboardermag Park & Ride Poll. Thanks to all the riders who get after it every day and to the @mammothunbound crew for making magic out there!

Check out the latest Hot Laps featuring @juddhenkes and @lyonfarrell. Shot and edited by @logan_sean @redbull @oakleysnowboarding

node.title: Best Terrain Park in the Country

node.text:
Dave McCoy was a true pioneer in the ski industry, and while he built one of the most successful resorts in the country, he was always most focused on having fun and bringing skiing to the people. Dave's life and legacy is one to be grateful for and to celebrate in the best way we know how – by going skiing together.

Join us on Feb 28 for a day of celebration in honor of Dave. #ThankYouDave Link in bio for more info.

node.text:
🔊 Looking to increase your excitement levels while out on the mountain? @mammothunbound has you covered.

With 7 terrain parks, 2 halfpipes and over 150 features there’s something for everyone – let the hoots, hollers and “hell yeahs!” commence!

Vote for Unbound in the @snowboardermag Park & Ride Poll, link in bio. 📹 @logan_sean 🏂 @bentheredenardthat @steezyneevy

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mammoth Mountain on August 24, 2021. May be an image of nature and sky.

node.text:
You won't want to miss the Summit Sunset Party on Sep 5 at the top of the Sierra! Ride the gondola to the summit at dusk to watch the sun set over the Minarets and enjoy a live DJ set, food and drink concessions, a lighted glow walk to the Lakes Basin Overlook and more. 

Buy your tickets today at MammothMountain.com

node.text: As the Summer Games are now in the rear view mirror, stoke for winter is already high. @mikaelashiffrin has her eyes on the prize - a spot on the US Olympic Team and a medal in Beijing. We were so stoked to have the 🐐 training at Mammoth in May and can’t wait to see what this season holds. 🇺🇸⛷🥇👑

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mammoth Mountain on August 11, 2021. May be an image of tree, road and nature.

node.text:
The Sept 11 Mammoth Gran Fondo is a true “bucket list” ride with 102-, 70-, and 42-mile options. Enjoy beautiful, quiet roads with minimal traffic plus an after-ride party in The Village with food and entertainment.

Learn more and register today at MammothMountain.com

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mammoth Mountain on August 10, 2021. May be an image of sky, twilight and nature.

node.text:
Get down at sundown on Sep 5 - the Summit Sunset Party is back! Ride the Panorama Gondola to the top of the mountain at dusk to watch the sunset over the Minarets. Enjoy a lighted glow walk to the Lakes Basin Overlook, a live DJ set, and food and drink offerings.

Buy your tickets at MammothMountain.com - link in stories.
